channel.title: CoinDesk: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Crypto News and Price Data

image.title: CoinDesk: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Crypto News and Price Data

item.title: Binance Exec Who Escaped From Nigeria Has Been Found in Kenya, Faces Extradition: Reports
item.dc:creator: Sandali Handagama
item.description: Nadeem Anjarwalla, who escaped Nigerian custody in March, could be extradited back to the country within the week, one local media outlet reported citing government sources.

item.title: Crypto Exchange Woo X Claims a First With Tokenized Treasury Bills for Retail Investors
item.dc:creator: Ian Allison
item.description: The Woo X RWA Earn Vaults have been built in partnership with institutional tokenization firm OpenTrade.

media:content.media:description: Woo X Chief Operating Officer Willy Chuang (WOO X)

item.title: Thailand to Block Access to 'Unauthorized' Crypto Platforms
item.dc:creator: Amitoj Singh
item.description: Authorities in Thailand have decided to block "unauthorized" crypto platforms to increase the efficiency of law enforcement in solving the problem of online crime, an announcement on Friday last week said.

item.title: Bitcoin Miners May Shift Focus to AI After Halving, CoinShares Says
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: Miners will be faced with substantial cost increases as a result of the halving, with electricity and bitcoin production costs almost doubling, the report said.

item.title: Bitcoin Layer 2 Coins, STX, ELA, SAVM, Outperform BTC After Halving
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole

item.title: Bitcoin Transaction Fees Come Crashing Down Post Halving
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: After the halving, fees spiked to $146 for a medium-priority transaction and $170 for a high-priority transaction.

item.title: Bitcoin Miners Reap Windfall as 'Runes' Debut Sends Transaction Fees to Record Highs
item.dc:creator: Bradley Keoun
item.description: The Bitcoin "halving" was supposed to dramatically chop revenue of bitcoin mining companies. Instead, the simultaneous launch of Casey Rodarmor's Runes protocol has ignited a flurry activity on the oldest and largest blockchain, driving up fees.

media:content.media:description: Screenshot from Hell Money podcast, with Runes creator Casey Rodarmor (right) (Hell Money)

item.title: Grayscale's Planned Mini Bitcoin ETF Will Have a 0.15% Fee, the Lowest Among Spot Bitcoin ETFs
item.dc:creator: Ian Allison
item.description: Bitcoin ETF provider Grayscale has provided some illustrative details of its spin-off fund, the Bitcoin Mini Trust (BTC), including a more competitive 0.15% fee than the uplisted mothership GBTC product, according to a pro forma financials in its latest filing.

item.title: Runes Protocol Launches on Bitcoin, Sending Fees Soaring as Users Rush to Mint Tokens
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn

media:content.media:description: Leonidas's DOG•GO•TO•THE•MOON token secured a coveted satoshi during the fourth Bitcoin halving. (DOG•GO•TO•THE•MOON)

item.title: Bitcoin Rally Holds Around $63,700 Following 4th Block Reward Halving
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight

item.title: The Bitcoin Halving Is Here, and With It a Giant Surge in Transaction Fees
item.dc:creator: Jamie Crawley, Sam Reynolds
item.description: Soccer has the World Cup. Athletics and many other sports have the Olympics. Crypto has the halving. The milestone in the blockchain's 15-year history technically means a cut in rewards for crypto miners with each block – a feature designed to minimize inflation.

media:content.media:description: Screenshot of livestreamed watch party hosted by Tone Vays (YouTube)

item.title: Indian Man Pleads Guilty to Creating Spoofed Coinbase Website, Stealing $9.5M in Crypto
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: According to court documents, Chirag Tomar used his ill-gotten gains to buy Rolexes, Lamborghinis, Porches and more.

media:content.media:description: He bought a Lambo, allegedly. (Wes Tindel/Unsplash)

item.title: Bitcoin Pioneer Hal Finney Posthumously Wins New Award Named for Him
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn

item.title: Bitcoin Whales Bought $1.2B BTC Amid the Price Dip, Fueling the Quick Rebound
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: Large bitcoin investors substantially increased their holdings as prices dipped below $60,000 in early Friday's panicky action on the crypto markets ahead of the asset's much-anticipated halving event.
item.media:keywords: bitcoin, bitcoin whales, bitcoin dip, bitcoin price

item.title: IRS Unveils Form Your Broker May Send Next Year to Report Your Crypto Moves
item.dc:creator: Jesse Hamilton
item.description: The U.S. Internal Revenue Services (IRS) has previewed what crypto investors' future tax form might look like when it finishes its much-debated rule on how cryptocurrency transactions should be reported to the federal government.

media:content.media:description: The U.S. Internal Revenue Service has posted an early draft of the U.S. tax form for reporting crypto transactions. (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)

item.title: Bitcoin Will Power the Next DeFi Summer
item.dc:creator: Brendon Sedo

media:content.media:description: Token unlocks are usually bearish events, increasing a token's supply.(FLY:D/Unsplash)

item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn
item.description: One of the closely watched indicators of retail interest is booming.

item.dc:creator: Patrick Dugan

item.title: Crypto Markets Will Be Driven by Macro Factors Following the Halving, Coinbase Says
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: These influences include rising geopolitical tensions, higher interest rates for longer, reflation and ballooning national debts, the report said.

media:content.media:description: Geopolitical and macroeconomic factors are likely to influence the bitcoin price after the halving. (Kyle Glenn/Unsplash)

item.description: The latest price moves in bitcoin (BTC) and crypto markets in context for April 19, 2024. First Mover is CoinDesk’s daily newsletter that contextualizes the latest actions in the crypto markets.

item.title: Tether Seeks to Boost Peer-to-Peer Payments on Telegram by Expanding Dollar, Gold Stablecoins to TON Network
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: The TON network has seen rapid growth recently helped by incentives for onboarding Telegram users.

item.title: Bitcoin Spot ETFs Register Five-Day Withdrawals Streak Ahead of Halving
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: GBTC again led the outflows, while inflows into BlackRock's IBIT continued to slow, provision data from Farside show.

item.title: Bitcoin Miners Are Better Positioned for the Halving This Time Round: Benchmark
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: Bitcoin's rally in the past six months will help cushion crypto miners from the effects of the 50% cut in their earned rewards, the report said.

item.title: Polymarket Traders See 32% Chance of No Fed Rate Cuts This Year
item.dc:creator: Omkar Godbole
item.description: The hawkish shift in the market sentiment could dampen the demand for risk assets, including cryptocurrencies and technology stocks.

item.title: Bitcoin Back Above $62K as Crypto Market Calms After Reports of Limited Damage From Israeli Attack
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: Iran's first strike on Israel pushed down crypto and risk assets, while leading to a spike in gold.

item.title: Chia Network Makes Progress Toward an IPO, CEO Says
item.dc:creator: Nikhilesh De
item.description: The cryptocurrency company founded by BitTorrent's inventor saw its IPO plans derailed last year by financial woes at its banker, Credit Suisse.

media:content.media:description: Chia Network CEO Gene Hoffman (CoinDesk TV)

item.title: This Bitcoin Halving Is Different. But Is It 'Priced In'?
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kuhn, Aoyon Ashraf, Jamie Crawley
item.description: Institutions launching Bitcoin ETFs this year have buoyed the bitcoin price to record levels. Does that mean the impact of the halving — the four-year slashing of the bitcoin reward — will be relatively muted this time, as any pontential bump is “priced in”?

item.title: Avail Confirms Token Airdrop Plans, a Week After Leaked Screenshots
item.dc:creator: Margaux Nijkerk
item.description: Avail shared in a blog post that 354,605 wallet addresses are eligible to claim the 600 million tokens in their “unification drop.”

media:content.media:description: Avail co-founders Anurag Arjun and Prabal Banarjee (Avail)

item.title: Sen. Lummis: It'll Pay to 'Choose Circle Over Tether' Under U.S. Stablecoin Proposal
item.dc:creator: Jesse Hamilton
item.description: Circle Internet Financial would have a distinct advantage over global stablecoin leader Tether under U.S. regulations along the lines being suggested by new legislation, according to one of the latest bill's authors, Sen. Cynthia Lummis (R-Wyo.).

media:content.media:description: U.S. Sen. Cynthia Lummis says her stablecoin proposal would favor U.S.-oriented issuers. (Shutterstock/CoinDesk)

item.title: Bitcoin Halving Is Not a Bullish Event, Says 10x Research Analyst
item.dc:creator: Helene Braun
item.description: Bearish signals are looming over the crypto market these days and will almost certainly push prices down in the short term, well-known research analyst Markus Thielen said.
item.media:keywords: bitcoin price, bitcoin correction, bitcoin sell off, btc, halving, fed, interest rates

media:content.media:description: The bitcoin halving is not a bullish event, well-known research analyst Markus Thielen said. (Volodymyr Baleha/Shutterstock)

item.title: Kraken Is Buying TradeStation Crypto, Expanding Cryptocurrency Exchange's U.S. Reach
item.dc:creator: Ian Allison
item.description: The takeover, which hasn't been previously disclosed publicly, expands the cryptocurrency exchange's regulatory licensing in the U.S.

item.title: Mango Markets Exploiter Avi Eisenberg Found Guilty of Fraud and Manipulation
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Ligon
item.description: NEW YORK – A Manhattan jury has found crypto trader Avi Eisenberg guilty on fraud and market manipulation for his $110 million heist from decentralized finance protocol Mango Markets in October 2022.

item.title: ‘It Can Be Said With Confidence the SEC Is Investigating Ethereum’: Consensys’ Bill Hughes Talks Crypto Law

item.description: Crypto prices are likely to stay high in anticipation of spot ether ETF approvals, central bank rate cuts, and regulatory changes, the report said.

item.title: Protecting Crypto Users Is More Important Than Faster UK Registration: FCA Executive
item.dc:creator: Camomile Shumba

item.title: USDe Holders Should Monitor Ethena's Reserve Fund to Avoid Risk, CryptoQuant Warns
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Cryptocurrency data provider CryptoQuant has said that holders of Ethena Labs' USDe stablecoin should monitor the project's reserve fund to avoid risks related to the potential of a negative funding rate.

item.title: Binance Could Come Back to India by Paying $2M Fine: Report
item.dc:creator: Parikshit Mishra
item.description: The exchange could return as a FIU-registered firm after paying the fine, the report added.
